text: Wendell Richard Anderson (February 1, 1933 - July 17, 2016) was an American politician. He was the 33rd Governor of Minnesota from January 4, 1971 to December 29, 1976. In late 1976, he resigned to be named U.S. Senator. He replaced Senator Walter Mondale, who had been elected Vice President of the United States. Anderson was in the U.S. Senate from December 30, 1976 until December 29, 1978. He was a member of the Democratic–Farmer–Labor Party. Anderson died on July 17, 2016 from pneumonia in St. Paul, Minnesota, aged 83.Wendell Anderson, former Minnesota governor, dead at 83 ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1933 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:United States senators from Minnesota Category:Governors of Minnesota Category:Politicians from Saint Paul, Minnesota
title: Wendell R. Anderson
